text:
The BuzzFeed staff is always trying new products, apps, hacks, and DIY projects, and we decided it was time to start sharing the best of them with you. Each month, we post our recommendations for what’s actually worth it. For the sake of transparency, items under “Things We Bought” and “Tricks We Learned” were purchased with our own money and/or were not the result of a PR pitch. Those under “Things We Tried” are items that were provided to us at no cost for the sake of review. (But! We’re under no obligation to write a review of those things, let alone a positive review.) Let us know in the comments what sorts of things you’d like us to review next month!

Zoe Burnett / BuzzFeed ID: 10257395 1. Black and Decker Cordless Hand Vac , a rechargable compact vacuum that’s the perfect combo of light and powerful. Mallory McInnis
Mallory McInnis
 Every modern human being who isn’t a slovenly lump needs a vacuum. But when you have an apartment that’s approximately the same size as a millionaire’s daughter’s playhouse (like I do), you really don’t want to devote space to a full-size one. My solution = this delightful little hand vac . It’s a best-seller for a reason: it has enough power to suck up all the crumbs I end up Hansel-and-Gretel-ing all over my floors whenever I eat, but it’s light enough to lift up to vacuum off all my bookshelves without making my teeny tiny arm muscles ache. I keep it tucked away underneath my kitchen sink when I’m not using it and only need to charge it once every four vacuuming sessions or so. — Mallory McInnis
Between this and my Swiffer Wet Jet, my floors (as well as my shelves) are clean enough to eat off of.
Get it from Amazon for $59.88 .
ID: 10268203 2. Whole Foods Organic Lip Balm , a refreshing peppermint balm that’ll keep your lips hydrated and chap-free — even in the middle of winter. View this image ›
Natalie Brown “Ugh I hate how my lips are dry and peel-y every winter” — I used to say, smearing on whatever new variety of lip balm I picked up that year. I’ve been through so many of them: classic Chapstick, classic Blistex, Blistex medicated, $6 Rosebud salve, plain coconut oil, Lip Smacker’s, Carmex in a tube, Vaseline…I could keep going. But after discovering the Whole Foods Peppermint Lip Balm four years ago, I’ve never gone back. Of course, all of the other treatments I tried gave me temporary relief, but they eventually stopped working — this balm has just kept chugging along, keeping my lips happy with just an application after every meal.
It comes in flavors other than mint, but the mint is my favorite by far. My mom’s a convert now, too: I gave her a tube two years ago, and this Christmas she was telling me all about how it’s her favorite lip balm. It also gets bonus points for being less than $2 per tube, which is better than the $6-8 per tube you pay for some luxury balms.
I keep one at my desk at work, one in my purse, one in my makeup bag, one in my bedside table, one in the kitchen silverware drawer — it’s the only cosmetic I keep multiples of, because I use it so often. Of course, what works for my face may not work for your face. But if you’re ready to try something new for your chapped lips, especially if you’ve tried lots of traditional balms, I def recommend giving this a try! — Natalie Brown
Get a 12-pack from Amazon for $18.99 .
ID: 10272633 3. Naked Cow Fire Beef Jerky , grass-fed beef jerky that is actually spicy! Jeff Barron
Jeff Barron
 Yet another shoutout to my brother Jimmy for getting me hooked on another thing I can’t get enough of. Naked Cow Beef Jerky . When I was growing up, my dad made pounds of beef jerky at home. Grocery store jerkies don’t really do a good job capturing the true spirit of what a proper jerky ought to be. They aren’t nearly dry enough and they overdo it on the sweetness. They basically taste like a lightly humid meat that’s been just seasoned as an afterthought. Yeah I’m a jerky critic.
So without sounding like I’m too far up my ass about jerky, here are the main points to take away:
1. Naked Cow is actually spicy. I eat spicy foods regularly and these still have a great kick to them. If you’re not into spicy things, they also have them in honey and smoke flavors.
2. It is actually dry and has a delightful texture. Seriously, it’s so nice to have something that’s actually got some chew to it.
3. It’s expensive. Wow holy shit I thought drugs were expensive, and then I learned that I will be paying about $22 for three bags of jerky. Each bag is 2.25oz (that’s around 64 grams for you folks who prefer sane measuring systems). I want to say that it may not be worth it, but every time I open up a bag and have a taste, I can’t help myself.
Fuck it, I’m adding beef jerky to my monthly budget. — Jeff Barron
Get it from Amazon for $22 .
ID: 10267610 4. Herbivore Botanicals Blue Tansy Resurfacing Clarity Mask , a clarifying mask that’s non-irritating and great for even sensitive skin. Megan Paolone
Megan Paolone
 2016 was the year I learned how to properly take care of my skin, and Herbivore Botanicals Blue Tansy Resurfacing Clarity Mask was my inspiration. I bought this (not-cheap) mask on a whim over the summer after a Birchbox employee recommended it to me, and I’ve been marveling at it ever since. Before Blue Tansy, I dreaded taking my makeup off and doing my nighttime skin routine, and now — I can’t believe I’m saying this — I look forward to it. I have dry, sensitive skin with mild rosacea that causes the occasional bout of acne, and this is the only mask I’ve ever used that’s made a distinct, long-term difference in my complexion.
Blue Tansy is an herbal-smelling blue-green gel that goes on clear. It’s not messy like some of the clay masks and peels I’ve used, and it comes with its own spatula so you don’t contaminate the pot with your grimy fingers. Put it on cleansed skin, leave on until it’s dry and you’re feeling tingly (for about 20 minutes), rinse with warm water, and continue your skin care regime normally. No more blackheads, my previously giant pores look smaller, and my skin is noticeably less red, smoother, and brighter immediately after use. Seriously, after I use this stuff, I cannot stop touching my face. More than once I’ve kept a pimple at bay with this stuff. Plus, it’s is mild enough (no alcohol!) to use more than once a week.
It’s expensive for a 2.3-ounce jar, but I’ve been using the same one consistently since August, and still have almost half. Do something good for yourself in 2017 and buy this mask. (I sure as heck will be buying other Herbivore Botanicals products if they’re half as good as this one.) I promise Blue Tansy is worth the $50 you will spend. It’s refreshing, revitalizing, and now an absolutely requisite part of my skin care routine. —Megan Paolone
Get it from Sephora for $48 or Amazon for $50 .
ID: 10257582 5. Marpac Dohm Natural White Noise Machine , a soothing device you can adjust and personalize for the best night of sleep you’ve ever had. View this image ›
Jeff Barron I sleep every night, and I’m sure you do too. Quality of sleep is important, and sometimes our environment doesn’t see eye to eye on keeping it down when you’ve got a lot of shit to do the next day. I live with four other people, and while they are respectful, it’s inevitable that someone is going to be inconvenienced by noise. There are quite a few gadgets out there that will generate white noise for you, but this one in particular is special because it doesn’t have a speaker that plays any sound. It actually recreates white noise by using a spinning fan and a rotatable housing that you can physically manipulate to change the frequency of the wind noise.
I still can’t get over how effective this is at improving my sleep. I don’t wake up anymore when my roommates are rummaging through the kitchen or taking a particularly loud shower. The rushing sound of air just masks all the background noise and lets my brain drift off to sleep way more easily. There are other gadgets out there that will do the same or similar thing — it’s not difficult to just find a 10-hour track of white noise off YouTube to play through your phone. But I like that I can change the acoustics by just twisting the housing. I like that the sound is tied to a physical object I can change rather than just using an audio track. If you’re like me and see the value in something like that, I would give this a shot. — Jeff Barron
Get it from Amazon for $44.99 .
ID: 10267632 ID: 10267628 6. Acure Argan Oil , a lightweight and cruelty-free oil that’s like a superfood for your skin. amazon.com
Treye Green
 Acure Organic’s Argan Oil has been a welcome addition to my skincare routine. I will add a few drops to my moisturizer in the morning and my night cream at night for an extra boost of hydration. I will even occasionally use it on my beard in place of beard oil. It doesn’t leave my face feeling greasy or overly shiny. And the one ounce bottle is the perfect size for traveling, seeing that my toiletries bag can get a little out of control at times. — Treye Green
Get it from Amazon for $10.99 .
ID: 10281933 7. Happy Planner Accessory Pouch , an elasticized pencil case that attaches right to your notebook so you don’t have to hunt for a writing utensil when the mood to write strikes. Rachel W. Miller
Rachel W. Miller
 Since I began bullet journaling , I’ve acquired a lot of pens and markers. I’d been keeping an eye out for a good pencil case to keep in my work bag, but nothing met all of my requirements. (Which were: simple, pretty, and small — just big/long enough to hold my 4-5 favorite writing utensils and my white out pen.) Not having a pencil case wasn’t a huge deal, but it was on my “would be nice” list.
So when I came across this little pencil case in the Happy Planner section at Michaels, I was delighted. It’s truly the perfect size, isn’t too flashy, and it has an elastic band so I can strap it right to my journal . WHAT? This feature means I’m less likely to forget or misplace the case, and it’s extra convenient when, say, I’m running to a meeting (no more hunting for a pen)! There’s also a slim pocket on the front that makes a great home for the mini ruler that I’d been keeping in my journal’s back pocket. The perfect pencil case might not change everyone’s life, but if you’re the kind of person who is particular about your pens, pencils, and highlighters, you’ll understand why I’m so thrilled. — Rachel W. Miller
Get a similar Happy Planner pouch with an elastic band from Amazon for $6.90 .
ID: 10257550 8. Victoria’s Secret Matte Cream Lip Stain in Drama, a $14 bold liquid lipstick that stuck it out through a fancy New Year’s Eve rager. Elizabeth Lilly
Elizabeth Lilly
 I’m no wine-hued lip stain noob. I probably have close to a dozen in my makeup collection, but that didn’t stop me snatching this one up while waiting in line to pay for some unmentionables on December 30th. I love a matte liquid lipstick and am loyal to Kat Von D’s Everlasting Liquid Lipstick , but almost-New-Year, kinda-new-me made me give this one a try. That night I gave it a test run around my apartment and decided it would look perfect with my metallic, disco-y New Year’s Eve dress.
To prep, I dabbed on some lip balm, lined my lips in a fuchsia lip liner that was handy, and applied the lipstick with its applicator. Then I blotted off the excess, tapped on some translucent powder on top of the first layer to make it set, and finished with another layer of the product. The result was velvet-y and matte, as promised.
The rich color stood out in my hazy party pics at The McKittrick Hotel (aka the home of Sleep No More and setting of Gossip Girl season five, episode seven), stayed put through several vodka sodas sipped out of hard plastic cups, and added some extra glamour to my look while amongst strangers in ball gowns, corsets, and intricate masks.
A lip stain this is not — it’s really a cream lipstick that stays put if you prep it like a lipstick — but it’s matte and a dramatic, flattering color. — Elizabeth Lilly
Get it from Victoria’s Secret for $14 .
